content.description: This was climbed in an attempt to find a better-protected line through the beautiful white rock on the upper left portion of the Whitestone Slab. Unfortunately, such did not exist. However, the climbing is good and the rock is perfect. Begin by scrambling up to the Tree Skirt tree. From here a horizontal crack leads all the way to Smokehouse. Place some pro in the Tree Skirt corner and move around the arete to the flared horizontal. The climbing here is easy, but any gear in the horizontal crack will be marginal at best. Some cruxy moves right at the end of the traverse lead into better protection on Smokehouse. Romp up the upper Smokehouse crack to the top.
content.protection: Small rack to hand sized. I placed two tricams in the horizontal but they did not inspire confidence.

content.description: Climb directly up the left side of the arete without using the block to the left. Some crimps, finesse, and a big reach to a jug get you over the initial bulge. After the unprotected boulder problem start the difficulty drops to 5.easy. Contrived, but so is the regular route. Worth toproping along with the other variations nearby.
content.protection: Toprope

content.description: From the top of the block, trend right to the arête of the Going Vertical corner. Continue straight up to top when the arête arches right.
content.protection: Recommend top rope only.  Trees at top suitable for anchors.
content.location: Starts at the short right-facing corner that is about 8 ft. left of the very large right-facing corner on the left side of the main slab.  Walk off left.

content.description: Route is between "Bushwhack" and "Romancing the Stone" in the Fasulo "Rock Climbing in CT" guide.P1 - Start about 4 ft left of "Romancing the Stone" (about mid-way between Romancing and Bushwhack) and climb straight up on thin holds. 5.7+
content.protection: TR

content.description: Left of Nectar of the Gods. Start left of the pine tree, move up and right to skirt behind the tree to a finger crack. The crack fades & protection is scarce.
content.protection: Not very much protection. A top rope can be set up by hiking to the top. There is 1 tree pretty close to the edge, but the others are pretty far back (about 40'+/-).

content.description: Start 10' or so left of the pine tree on tree skirt. Climb straight up over some shallow diagonal cracks.
content.protection: Very little protection. A top rope can be set up by hiking to the top. There is 1 tree pretty close to the edge, but the others are pretty far back (40'+/-).

content.description: A good route for beginners.  Start up the slab 3 feet right of the large, right-trending crack system on the right side of the slab.  Follow the path of least resistance along the flake and crack to the obvious break in the overlap (crux).
content.protection: Small cams and nuts for the cracks. Trees at top suitable for TR anchors.

content.description: Stem or mantle up onto the boulder-like ledge on your right.  Then move up to a right-sloping ramp.  Find your feet and pull over the bulge on the left side (crux). Move right and continue up a small crack to the top.
content.protection: Small nuts and cams. A #2 Camalot protects the crux.  Boulders and trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: In a small clearing left of the two prominent right-facing corners. A couple of feet right of Nectar of the Gods.  Walk off left.

content.description: Follow a right-leaning cracks that end just below a ledge with bushy saplings.  Much easier bouldery ground above.  Fun but not very consistent.
content.protection: Standard rack to 2".  Trees at top suitable for TR anchors.
content.location: Between the two large, right-facing corners. Walk off left.

content.description: Climb the slab and arete along the right edge of the slab.  Skirt the overlap on the right side. The route merges with Stone Age at the top.
content.protection: Trees suitable for TR anchors at top.
content.location: On the far right of the slab.  Walk off left.

content.description: Start on "Romancing the Stone"P 1 - Start on the "Romancing the Stone" crack, but 8 ft up continue straight where the crack veers right. Two 5.7 moves lead to the top of "Bushwhack."
content.protection: TR

content.description: Climb the crack to the right of Romancing the Stone. When you get to the top of the crack, wander up easier rock to the top of the cliff.
content.protection: Good pro once you get up to the crack.
content.location: Halfway between Romancing the Stone and the Vertical Limit arete.

content.description:
Climb up the dark streak (see               

Fred starts up Nectar of the Gods      ).  Pull over the bulge and up the nice, white rock to the top on tiny holds.
content.protection: Recommend TR only.  Very little pro.  Trees and boulders at top for anchors.
content.location: In a small clearing left of the two prominent right-facing corners. A couple of feet left of Smokehouse, but on the righthand side of the Tree Skirt pine tree.  Walk off left.

content.description: P1 - Starting 5 ft right of the "Romancing" Crack, pad your way up slopers until clean crimps lead to the final good horizontal on top. There are both "straight up" and "right hand" variants to the exit sequence. About 5.8 Perhaps more difficult if short.A handy bush/tree provides a nice directional for a top rope.
content.protection: TR or R/X the bottom

content.description: Thin face and slab up to the overlap. Pull the overlap about 3 feet right of "Stone Age".  Continue up about 4 feet right of the "Stone Age" right facing corner following a thin, shallow, intermittent crack.
content.protection: No pro until almost at the overlap. Sparse after that.
content.location: Black face midway between "Stone Age" and "Simpler Times". Trees at top for anchor. Walk off to climbers left.

content.description: Route is between the "Going Vertical" crack and "A Prime Climb"P1 - Begin 3-4 feet right of the right facing inside corner on "Going Vertical" and face climb directly up to the black overlap. For extra adventure, finish on "Dead Vertical"
content.protection: TR or usual rack (no pro for the first 5 or 6 meters)

content.description: Follow the large crack system that starts at the right-facing corner on the left of the main slab.  Surmount the overhang at the black rock/crack.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Trees at top suitable for TR anchors but be advised that the route traverses a bit.
content.location: Start at the large right-facing corner on the left side of the main slab.  Walk off left.

content.description: Route is on the face to the left of "Back in Time". "Back in Time" is the left facing corner furthest climber's left on the slab in the Fasulo "Rock Climbing in CT" guide.Note the COMMENTs relative to LOCATION. NOTE: On 6/13/18 I moved this route further left and added photo.P1 - Climb the face and outside corner, moving right near the top to avoid the small pine tree. ( 5.8 - 5.9 ?)
content.protection: TR

content.description: Stem the right facing inside corner to it's top. Step right and pull through the center of the overhang (height related crux). Continue straight to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack, small/medium gear. Trees at top suitable for TR anchors.
content.location: Start at the large right-facing corner on the left side of the main slab (same as "Going Vertical"). Walk off left.

content.description: Start up the Going Vertical corner. However, about 2/3 of the way up, climb left over the corner at a good horizontal and finish up the Vertical Limit Face.It's also possible, at the same grade, to stay to the right of the corner all the way to its top where it meets the small roof (as for Dead Vertical), then step left over the corner and again continue to the top. Both are good variations to the routes here.
content.protection: Standard rack

content.description: Climb through notch heading for 3-4# crack. exit overhang on left , follow line of least resistance up to the top.
content.protection: Trad gear.
content.location: Start 20 feet below slab next to 4th class walk up. a few feet left of palm pilot start.

content.description: Climb the arete to the right of simpler times.  Straight up past the overhang heading for small tree. Sling tree for pro. Follow thin moves straight up with sparse gear to top.
content.protection: Ok, but not great for new leader.

content.description: Start a few feet to the right of "Stone Age"Climb straight up crossing "Stone Age". Once at the overlap, use the very thin crack to climb the overlap midway between "Stone Age" and "A Prime Climb". Finish just left of the Arete. About 5.8
content.protection: TR or small stuff

content.description: Climb the right facing corner left of Romancing, exit right-ish.
content.protection: Std rack - I seem to remember a red or green Camalot useful on the moves right at the top.

content.description: Layback left onto a platform. Climb the left side of the arete and diagonal left to a ledge with a large flake directly below an overhang with two thin vertical seams. Climb the overhang at the right seam and mantle onto a flake. Step right and up to a good bucket and mantle to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack, mostly small gear. Possible hook at the top.
content.location: Start at the large right facing inside corner to the right of Smokehouse and left of Romancing The Stone(Same start as Bushwhack).

content.description: Climb right side of the arete to the overlap  and "Y" crack. Look for the "Bat Signal". Finish up the right facing corner and roof
content.protection: Tree anchor at top
content.location: Start just right of the arete that is right of "Simpler Times".

content.description: Same start as Tree Skirt (just left of the pine tree that grows about 10' up on the face), but move left onto the bald face as you pass the tree.  Straight up to the top.
content.protection: Top rope only.  No pro.  Walk off left.
content.location: Far left side of the slab.  Left of the pine tree that grows about 12 feet up the cliff.

content.description: Up obvious weakness capped by crux lieback move at the top of left facing corner,  then trend to the right of small tree at the top of wall. Another good moderate lead on the whitstone slab area.
content.protection: Larger cams . #4 friend and doubles in the 2'' range, are the most obvious placements. a big nut backs up the crux lieback . g-pg with the big gear.
content.location: Climbers left of the crag. obvious grove/corner , left of baldy, super stout.

content.description: Follow the large, right-trending crack system to the overlap.  Step left a few feet and surmount the overlap at an awkward, smaller crack (crux).
content.protection: Mostly small nuts and cams. Run-out above overlap.
content.location: Look for the largest, right-trending crack system on the right side of the slab.  Walk off left.

content.description: The Main Slab is the most popular crag in the area.  It faces southwest and is 80 feet wide with lower angle routes to right and more vertical climbing to the left.  The routes are generally between 40-60 ft long. Most are leadable and all can be top roped from trees and boulders at the top.  Bring a long static or webbing since many trees near the edge have died.
